body_html: Thanks for the reply. What kind of annotation tool you used for the training and I need some more information on the inputs to be provided to training can you explain me in more clear way that is step by step Regards Devanandd MG From: Akhtar303nu [mailto:notifications@github.com] Sent: Monday, September 24, 2018 7:45 PM To: tensorflow/tensorflow <tensorflow@noreply.github.com> Cc: Devanandd M G <Devanandd.MG@LntTechservices.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com> Subject: Re: [tensorflow/tensorflow] OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: saved_model_dir/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb} (#22480) @Akhtar303nu<https://github.com/Akhtar303nu> Can you guide me with the step by step procedures to be followed for the training to obtain the model file (.pb) in the format Thanks @devanandd8245<https://github.com/devanandd8245> I take pretrained model of Google (https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/object_detection/g3doc/detection_modo.md) it genrate same error in my case code: import tensorflow as tf converter = tf.contrib.lite.TocoConverter.from_saved_model('ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28') converter.post_training_quantize = True tflite_quantized_model = converter.convert() open("quantized_model.tflite", "wb").write(tflite_quantized_model) Error: 018-09-24 18:56:08.695359: I tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:141] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX2 FMA Traceback (most recent call last): File "t.py", line 2, in converter = tf.contrib.lite.TocoConverter.from_saved_model('ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28') File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/lite.py", line 339, in from_saved_model output_arrays, tag_set, signature_key) File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/convert_saved_model.py", line 239, in freeze_saved_model meta_graph = _get_meta_graph_def(saved_model_dir, tag_set) File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/convert_saved_model.py", line 61, in _get_meta_graph_def return loader.load(sess, tag_set, saved_model_dir) File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 192, in load loader = SavedModelLoader(export_dir) File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 208, in init self._saved_model = _parse_saved_model(export_dir) File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 81, in _parse_saved_model constants.SAVED_MODEL_FILENAME_PB)) OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb} — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#22480 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ApIcQ1pvV-MPaymcXsCN1FuIDkAbBSKaks5ueOjRgaJpZM4W2fFp>. body_text:
Thanks for the reply.
What kind of annotation tool you used for the training and I need some more information on the inputs to be provided to training can you explain me in more clear way that is step by step


Regards
Devanandd MG
From: Akhtar303nu [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: Monday, September 24, 2018 7:45 PM
To: tensorflow/tensorflow <tensorflow@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Devanandd M G <Devanandd.MG@LntTechservices.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [tensorflow/tensorflow] OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: saved_model_dir/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb} (#22480)


@Akhtar303nu<https://github.com/Akhtar303nu> Can you guide me with the step by step procedures to be followed for the training to obtain the model file (.pb) in the format
Thanks @devanandd8245<https://github.com/devanandd8245> I take pretrained model of Google (https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/object_detection/g3doc/detection_modo.md)
it genrate same error in my case
code:
import tensorflow as tf
converter = tf.contrib.lite.TocoConverter.from_saved_model('ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28')
converter.post_training_quantize = True
tflite_quantized_model = converter.convert()
open("quantized_model.tflite", "wb").write(tflite_quantized_model)

Error:

018-09-24 18:56:08.695359: I tensorflow/core/platform/cpu_feature_guard.cc:141] Your CPU supports instructions that this TensorFlow binary was not compiled to use: AVX2 FMA
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "t.py", line 2, in
converter = tf.contrib.lite.TocoConverter.from_saved_model('ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28')
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/lite.py", line 339, in from_saved_model
output_arrays, tag_set, signature_key)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/convert_saved_model.py", line 239, in freeze_saved_model
meta_graph = _get_meta_graph_def(saved_model_dir, tag_set)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/convert_saved_model.py", line 61, in _get_meta_graph_def
return loader.load(sess, tag_set, saved_model_dir)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 192, in load
loader = SavedModelLoader(export_dir)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 208, in init
self._saved_model = _parse_saved_model(export_dir)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 81, in _parse_saved_model
constants.SAVED_MODEL_FILENAME_PB))
OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb}

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
Thanks for the reply.
What kind of annotation tool you used for the training and I need some more information on the inputs to be provided to training can you explain me in more clear way that is step by step


Regards
Devanandd MG
From: Akhtar303nu [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: Monday, September 24, 2018 7:45 PM
To: tensorflow/tensorflow <tensorflow@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Devanandd M G <Devanandd.MG@LntTechservices.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [tensorflow/tensorflow] OSError: SavedModel file does not exist at: saved_model_dir/{saved_model.pbtxt|saved_model.pb} (#22480)


@Akhtar303nu<https://github.com/Akhtar303nu> Can you guide me with the step by step procedures to be followed for the training to obtain the model file (.pb) in the format
Thanks @devanandd8245<https://github.com/devanandd8245> I take pretrained model of Google (https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/object_detection/g3doc/detection_modo.md)
it genrate same error in my case
code:
import tensorflow as tf
converter = tf.contrib.lite.TocoConverter.from_saved_model('ssd_mobilenet_v1_coco_2018_01_28')
converter.post_training_quantize = True
tflite_quantized_model = converter.convert()
open("quantized_model.tflite", "wb").write(tflite_quantized_model)

Error:

output_arrays, tag_set, signature_key)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/lite/python/convert_saved_model.py", line 239, in freeze_saved_model

return loader.load(sess, tag_set, saved_model_dir)

loader = SavedModelLoader(export_dir)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 208, in init
self._saved_model = _parse_saved_model(export_dir)
File "/home/akhtar/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/tensorflow/python/saved_model/loader_impl.py", line 81, in _parse_saved_model
constants.SAVED_MODEL_FILENAME_PB))
